newsitem.title: JAPAN: JR East shares hurt by JR West listing.
newsitem.headline: JR East shares hurt by JR West listing.

text.p: Shares in East Japan Railway Co were depressed on Tuesday morning after the first traded price of West Japan Railway Co, listed on Tuesday, turned out to be lower than market expectations, brokers said.
As of 0122 GMT, JR East shares were down 7,000 yen at 519,000 yen with a trade volume of 3,222 shares.

Brokers said a bout of weakness hit JR East shares on Monday after they posted modest gains for most of last week as investors bought the shares in order to provide support for the listing of JR West.

The weak sentiment carried over into today's session, and the shares were battered further when the first traded price of the newly listed JR West shares fell short of market expectations, which had been for a price of around 385,000 to 400,000 yen, they said.
